Major_Arcs.title: The Airport and Romantic Entanglements
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Nan and her romantic feelings amidst the backdrop of Ghost Town's demolition for an airport. It sets up her personal conflicts and emotional vulnerabilities.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Refusal and Ghost Town Skepticism
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the main characters and the initial conflicts: the woman in green hat's refusal and the debate about Ghost Town's existence.

sub_scenes.title: Flashback and Modern Disruption
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene juxtaposes a nostalgic flashback of Ghost Town with the harsh reality of modern development plans to destroy it.

narrative_arcs.title: Modern Day Disruption: Airport Plans for Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Romantic vs. Practical and Construction Site Encounter
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene contrasts romantic ideals with harsh realities and introduces the construction workers, highlighting the woman's displacement and emotional vulnerability.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with Construction Workers and Disdain

sub_scenes.title: Business and Family Pressure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the business motivations behind the airport and introduces family dynamics, with Nan facing pressure from her father.

sub_scenes.title: Conflicting Advice and Nan's Decision
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan receiving conflicting advice about her relationship with Cal, leading to her decision to seek direct confirmation from him.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses to the Airport and the Deal

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confession and Rejection
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays Nan's emotional confession to Cal and his somewhat detached response, leading to a moment of separation and reflection.

Major_Arcs.title: The Blizzard and Community Resilience
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to a severe blizzard and its impact on the community, showcasing their struggles, concerns for livestock, and ultimate relief.

sub_scenes.title: Weather's Harsh Impact
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the onset of a severe blizzard, its immediate effects on characters, and the widespread concerns it raises.

narrative_arcs.title: Recollections of Changed Weather and Difficult Journey
Seeking Comfort and Reassurance Amidst Hardship
Recalling Past Winter's Severity and Impending Starvation
Riding Out to Face the Crisis and Uncertain Future

sub_scenes.title: Waiting and Unexpected Relief
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the characters' anxious wait during the blizzard and the unexpected arrival of aid from the sky, bringing hope and relief.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Restlessness and Persistent Snowfall
The Sound of Hope: Arrival of a Plane
Relief from the Sky and Reflections on Romance

Major_Arcs.title: The Ballad of Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and his violent reputation, exploring themes of hero worship, gun violence, and romantic rivalry in a Western town setting.

sub_scenes.title: Cowtown Showdown and Character Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through a violent act and the varied reactions of the townspeople to his persona.

sub_scenes.title: Hero Worship and Gun Handling
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into Jeff's admiration for violent figures like his brother and Chane Benson, and his risky behavior with guns.

narrative_arcs.title: Advice on Decency and Confrontation with Benson

sub_scenes.title: Worries, Guidance, and Ominous Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene showcases Sally's deep concern for Jeff's path, her plea for Clyde's help, and the unsettling introduction of Mr. Benson, hinting at darker undercurrents.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern Over Jeff's Gun Obsession and Control
Reassurance and Premonition of Finding Jeff
Clyde's Retrospective Account of Jeff's Disappearance
Introducing Mr. Benson and Casual Banter
Mr. Benson's Ominous Tone Shift and Mention of Death

sub_scenes.title: Article Controversy and Tense Confrontations
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene revolves around Clyde's controversial article about Benson, leading to angry confrontations and escalating tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Justification for Writing About Benson
Sally's Distrust and Ominous Description of Benson
Benson's Threat to Clean Up Juniper Town

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Deceptive Politeness
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the plan to invite Chane Benson for dinner, driven by Sally's attempt to understand him, and the initial polite interactions during the dinner.

narrative_arcs.title: Flashback to Benson's Articles and Consequences
Considering Inviting Chane Benson for Dinner
Sally's Persuasion and Jeff's Agreement to Invite Chane
Invitation to Dinner and Observation of Chane's Demeanor
Discussion on Chane's Artistic Skills and Character

sub_scenes.title: Dinner's Downfall and Violent Climax
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the dinner party's descent into tension, jealousy, unwanted advances, and ultimately, violence, culminating in a fight and pursuit.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane's Confrontation and Accusation of Trap
Sally's Accusation and Demand for Honesty
Sally's Angry Explanation to Jeff about Chane's Actions and Intentions
Chane's Angry Confrontation and Jeff's Punch
Sally's Desperate Plea and Jeff's Fall
Urgent Warning and Chase After Chane

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Newspaper Triumph
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the conflict with Benson and Chane, focusing on Jeff's bravery, the community's relief, and the newspaper's role in upholding justice.

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Romantic Resolution at Double Bar Ranch
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to Betsy's ranch and the brewing range war, focusing on her leadership, romantic entanglement with Steve, and resolution of ranch conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Introduction and Looming Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Betsy and the Double Bar Ranch, setting up the initial conflict with ranch hands and the arrival of Steve Daley amidst brewing trouble.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation and Approbation of Steve Daley's Hiring

sub_scenes.title: Range War Details and Journey to Town
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the specifics of the impending range war and Betsy's journey to town with Steve, where her feelings for him start to evolve.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of Accommodation and Lingering Doubts
Journey into Town and Expressed Gratitude
Hank's Orders and Material for a Dress

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Imminent Violence
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy's confrontational encounter with Fred Bridges in town, escalating into a physical threat and the brink of a gunfight.

sub_scenes.title: Gunslinger Decision and Father's Approval
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Betsy's resolute decision to hire a gunslinger and her interaction with her father, gaining his somewhat reluctant approval.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Firm Decision to Hire a Gunslinger
Justification and Acceptance from Authority Figure
Hank's Concern and Betsy's Softened Stance

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confession and Commitment
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene marks the romantic climax between Betsy and Steve, with mutual confessions of love and promises of commitment amidst the ongoing ranch conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Sudden Intense Feelings and Mutual Confession

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Horse Theft
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Old Man Bridges' arrival and confrontation at the ranch, culminating in the theft of horses, escalating the range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Arrival and Ranch Hands' Confrontation
Betsy's Warning and Steve's Determination Amidst Threats
Betsy's Assertion of Authority on Gun Use
Aftermath: Horse Theft and Realization of Loss

sub_scenes.title: Desperate Ride and Devil's Pass Showdown
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays Betsy's desperate plea to stop Steve, his resolute departure, her realization, and the ride to Devil's Pass, leading to a violent confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Ride to Devil's Pass and Arrival at Gunfire Scene
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Love and Conflict on a Different Ranch
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Carrie and Dave's complicated relationship amidst ranch disputes and external threats, exploring themes of jealousy, misunderstanding, and ultimate romantic resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Rancher's Daughter's Conflict and Ranch Concerns
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Carrie and Dave's personal conflict alongside emerging ranch concerns about Curley and outsiders, setting up multiple threads of tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Concerns about Curley and Outsiders

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Gunpoint Standoff
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts a escalating fence dispute involving Fred Gordon and the Rancher, culminating in a gunpoint confrontation with Curley.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Lingering Guilt
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows attempts at reconciliation among riders, Carrie's explanation to Dave, and the undercurrent of guilt and unresolved feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confessions and Marriage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on emotional clarifications, shifting alliances, and ultimately, the romantic resolution between Carrie and Fred with a marriage proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Contract Betrayal and Business Victory
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the deception surrounding the Carlton contract, leading to Carrie's angry rejection of Dave and her eventual business triumph.

narrative_arcs.title: Assertion of Independence and Business Acumen

sub_scenes.title: Confession and Final Romantic Union
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene culminates in Carrie's confession of love for Fred, Dave's resigned departure, and Carrie's ultimate romantic union with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Intuition and Long Ride Reflection
Revelation of Fred's Arrival and Misunderstanding
Carlton's Explanation of the Beef Contract
Realization of Foolishness and Seeking Reassurance
Affectionate Embrace and Plea for Kiss

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance: A Western Justice Tale
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells the story of Dirk and Rance, focusing on mistaken identity, pursuit, gunfight, moral dilemmas, and eventual romantic resolution amidst law and justice themes.

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Intrusion and Injury Revelation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Dirk's urgent arrival and the revelation of his gunshot wound, setting up a mystery and immediate danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Revelation of Dirk's Injury and Medical Examination

sub_scenes.title: Grandfather's Investigation and Ranch Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the grandfather's concern and investigation, leading to a confrontation at the Ranch between the Marshal, the Ranch Owner, and Chris.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Confrontation and Demand for Authority

sub_scenes.title: Accusation, Truce, and Shifting Emotions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene clarifies the accusation against Dirk, establishes a temporary truce, and shows the Ranch Owner's evolving feelings towards Dirk and Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Law vs. Justice and Dirk's Injury

sub_scenes.title: Love Triangle and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene develops a love triangle between Chris, Rance, and the Ranch Owner, leading to Chris's confession and an escape plan for Dirk amidst jealousy and emotional turmoil.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Understanding and Escape Plan

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Gunfight, and Moral Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the escape attempt, the relentless pursuit by the Marshal, the violent confrontation, and the moral conflict arising from its aftermath.

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Return, and Conflicted Reunion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Dirk's escape to Mexico, Chris's surprising return to the wounded Rance, and the conflicted reunion between them.

narrative_arcs.title: Leaving the Wounded Marshal and Woman's Reflection
Dirk's Farewell and Escape to Mexico
Chris's Return to Rance and Woman's Thoughts
Rance's Pursuit and Dirk's Escape Confirmed

sub_scenes.title: Recovery, Forgiveness, and Wedding Climax
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Rance's recovery, the woman's forgiveness, their mutual confession of love, and the anticipated wedding day.

narrative_arcs.title: Clearing Chris's Name and Woman's Forgiveness
Confession of Love and Lingering Fear
Confrontation and Clarification at the Wedding
